sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"发现"之意。
means: discover ： 普通用词，指发现本来存在，但示被认识的事物、真理或情况。
find ： 普通用词，可指偶然发现，也可指经过寻找后得到或重新获得已失去的东西。强调动作的结果。
detect ： 正式用词，强调经过周密观察或研究而有所获得和发现，尤指发现有意隐藏之物。
ascertain ： 较正式用词，指有意搜寻与发现。

sentence.Network_en: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你从内心深处找到一种可以忍受一切痛苦的坚强力量时，你的成长历程就会出现飞跃。

sentence.Network_en: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
sentence.Network_cn: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

sentence.Network_en: He was stunned to discover cost overruns of at least $1 billion.
sentence.Network_cn: 他震惊地发现花费至少超了10亿美元。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'make known'): from Old French descovrir, from late Latin discooperire, from Latin dis- (expressing reversal) + cooperire 'cover completely' (see cover)

encyclopedia.content: 专辑概述 探索频道 美国的一档探索节目，纪录片形式，类似中央电视台的探索发现 概述 Discovery探索频道自一九八五年起在美国播出，自一九八九年起在北欧播出此外，在非洲、亚洲、澳大利亚、新西兰、加拿大、德国、印度、意大利、日本、拉丁美洲、西班牙、葡萄牙、土耳其和中东，也都收看得到Discovery探索频道。 目前Discovery探索频道在全球145个国家共有超过一亿四千四百万个收视户。Discovery提供高品质的非戏剧性节目，内容

entry.tran: 发现(以前不知道的事实)
entry.def: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.

example.tran: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。

entry.tran: (偶然)发现;找到(一直在寻找的某人或某物)
entry.def: If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.

example.ex: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.
example.tran: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。

entry.def: When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.

example.tran: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人

example.ex: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。

entry.tran: 初次接触(某活动并乐在其中)
entry.def: If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.

example.ex: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...
example.tran: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。

example.ex: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
example.tran: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

entry.tran: 发现，发掘(不为人所知的演员、音乐人等艺人)
entry.def: When an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.

example.ex: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。

means.word_mean: 1. discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of;

sentences.sentence: "She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water"
"We found traces of lead in the paint"

means.word_mean: 2. make a discovery, make a new finding;

sentences.sentence: "Physicists believe they found a new elementary particle"

means.word_mean: 3. get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "I learned that she has two grown-up children"
"I see that you have been promoted"
"She found that he had lied to her"
"The story is false, so far as I can discover"
"the archeologists chanced upon an old tomb"
"The hikers finally struck the main path to the lake"

means.word_mean: 6. make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret;

sentences.sentence: "The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold"
"The actress won't reveal how old she is"

means.word_mean: 7. see for the first time; make a discovery;
8. identify as in botany or biology, for example

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"分开,分离,去掉"; 2. 表示"否定,不,消失掉"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis否定,不,消失掉+graceful优美的→adj.可耻的, 不名誉的
dis否定,不,消失掉+honest诚实的→adj.不诚实的
dis否定,不,消失掉+incline愿意→adj.不愿的
dis否定,不,消失掉+passionate有激情的→adj.平心静气的
dis否定,不,消失掉+solute溶解→溶解开来→没有限制→放荡的
dis否定,不,消失掉+son声音+ant……的→声音不[好听]
dis分开,分离,去掉+cern搞清,确定+ment表名词→确定不同之处→有眼光

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不利, 不利条件, 缺点, 劣势
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis否定,不,消失掉+advantage优点,有利条件→n.不利, 不利条件, 缺点, 劣势
dis不+gust美味→n. 厌恶,恶心 v. 使厌恶
dis否定,不,消失掉+honour尊敬→毫无尊敬→丢脸
dis否定,不,消失掉+may能→不能做事→沮丧;参考:五月能种粮食,所以叫May
dis否定,不,消失掉+order顺序→没有顺序
dis否定,不,消失掉+proof证实→不证实→反证
dis分开,分离,去掉+course课程,教程→分解课程→论述→论文
dis分开+play=ply重叠→打开折叠→显示出来
dis分开,分离,去掉+affect感情→感情分开→疏远
dis分开,分离,去掉+burse钱包→从钱包中分出→支出
dis分开,分离,去掉+crimin分辨→ate→分辩开
dis分开,分离,去掉+cuss敲打→把[问题]分开敲→讨论
dis分开,分离,去掉+miss送→分开送出→解散
dis分开,分离,去掉+part部分→分成部分→分开
dis分开,分离,去掉+pens花费+e→分开花费→分配[财富等]
dis分开,分离,去掉+semin种子+ate表动词→散布[种子]
dis分开,分离,去掉+tend伸展,拉→分开伸展→膨胀
dis分开,分离,去掉+tract拉→把[心]拉开→分心
dis不+adapt使适应→v.使不适应
dis否定,不,消失掉+appear出现→不出现→消失
dis否定,不,消失掉+arm武装→去掉武装
dis否定,不,消失掉+courage勇气→v.使失去勇气
dis否定,不,消失掉+cover盖→把盖揭开→发现
dis不+gust美味→n. 厌恶,恶心 v. 使厌恶
dis否定,不,消失掉+honour尊敬→毫无尊敬→丢脸
dis否定,不,消失掉+like喜爱→不喜爱
dis否定,不,消失掉+organize组织→解散组织
dis否定,不,消失掉+pel推→推开→驱除

Sentence.sentence: Social workers discover that the wife normally tries to take care of her husband herself for as long as she can in order not to use up their life savings.
Part of your point you knew before hand but part you discovered as you wrote.
Although no form of matter yet discovered moves as fast as or faster than light, scientific experiments have already confirmed that accelerated motion causes a traveler's time to be stretched
All the causes of the sickness are not discovered yet.
Ted Hughes discovered many long poems submitted for poetry competition were composed on computers
After making inquiries Hughes discovered that they were being composed on computers, then just finding their way into British homes.

sentences.en: Recently they have discovered a comet.
sentences.cn: 最近他们发现了一颗彗星。

sentences.en: I never discovered how to open the box.
sentences.cn: 我一直未能发现该如何打开这个箱子。

sentences.en: She discovered that she was being closely watched.
We discovered her to be a good cook.
sentences.cn: 我们发现她是一个很好的厨师。

sentences.en: When returning back, he discovered the room to be in disorder.
sentences.cn: 回家后, 他发现屋子里乱七八糟。

sentences.en: They discovered him stealing public property.
sentences.cn: 他们发现他偷窃公共财产。

sentences.en: They discovered the murderer to have run away.
sentences.cn: 他们发现凶手已逃之夭夭。
他看见它到底是什么了。

means.word_mean: 了解到, 认识到, 发觉

jushi.english: One day while sweeping the compound he discovered seven eggs in a pile of straw.
jushi.chinese: 一天,他打扫院子时,发现乱草堆里有7个鸡蛋。

jushi.english: Our oil-workers have discovered another big oil field.
jushi.chinese: 我们的石油工人又发现了一个新油田。

jushi.english: Issac Newton discovered the law of gravity.
jushi.chinese: 艾萨克·牛顿发现了万有引力定律。
